response.overview: An experimental video collage built from analog footage filmed by the artistâ€™s father, A Forgotten Childhood returns to a rural Arctic landscape to examine how personal memory shifts over time. Moving between past and present, the film reflects on what is remembered, what fades, and how these fragments shape identity. Structured like a third-person diary entry, it binds images together through text, emphasizing the tension between documentary memory and personal mythology.
response.title: A forgotten childhood
